greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to +- 1 +- 2 +- 3 +- ... +- n = 1.
link: T. D. Noe and Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..3340 (terms < 10^1000, first 101 terms from T. D. Noe)
formula: a(n) equals the coefficient of x in Product_{k=1..n} (x^k + 1/x^k). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 10 2018
mathematica: d = PadLeft[d, Length[d] + 2 n] + PadRight[d, Length[d] + 2 n];
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, following a suggestion by _J. H. Conway_, Aug 27 2001
ext: More terms from _Dean Hickerson_ and _Vladeta Jovovic_, Aug 28 2001
